class_notes:
This seminar is centered around the careful reading of a set of texts meant to be representative of 17th- and 18th-century French literary culture, passing through the overflowing worlds of the baroque, the restrained yet powerful alexandrines of classical tragedy, comedies that have lost none of their satirical punch, and Diderot and D¿Alembert¿s massive Encyclopédie project. 
Prerequisites: French 310, French 314, 300-level placement recommendation, or instructor permission. 
Texts to purchase: Pierre Corneille, L'illusion comique (Classiques Larousse, ISBN 978-2-03-586791-9); Corneille, Cinna (Classiques Larousse, ISBN 978-2-03-585083-6); Marivaux, Le jeu de l'amour et du hasard (Classiques Larousse, ISBN 978-2-03-598710-5); Jean Racine, Andromaque (Classiques Larousse, ISBN 978-2-03-586809-1); Jean Rotrou, Le Véritable Saint-Genest (Classiques & Cie., ISBN 978-2-218-97169-3).
Other readings provided on Canvas: Françoise de Graffigny, Cénie; Germaine de Stael, Mirza; excerpts from Charles Sorel, Montesquieu, and the Encyclopédie. 
Expectations: attentive reading, engaged participation, four short essays, and a staged research paper.
course_description: A survey of literary and artistic creations of the 17th and 18th centuries, with special attention paid to the cultural and historical context in which they were produced. Course conducted in French.
